title: Service Coordinator
description:
**Yamaha Motor Scandinavia söker en Service Coordinator - Marinprodukter** 




  





*Yamaha Motor Scandinavia ingår i Yamaha-koncernen. Företaget är generalagent för koncernens samtliga motorprodukter som motorcyklar, båtmotorer, fyrhjulingar, tillbehör och reservdelar i Sverige, Norge, Danmark samt Island, Grönland och Färöarna. Produkterna representerar en betydande del av den europeiska marknaden för båtmotorer, motorcyklar och terränghjulingar. Man marknadsför och säljer även båtarna Finnmaster, Jeanneau och Husky. Företaget består av 58 personer som är fördelade på tre kontor i Sverige, Norge och Danmark.* 




  





**Till vår avdelning i Sverige söker vi nu en servicekoordinator för våra marina produkter.** 




 Du kommer att vara stationerad på huvudkontoret i Nacka, Stockholm, där det idag finns 38 anställda. På huvudkontoret finns flera avdelningar inklusive försäljning, service, eftermarknad och marknadsavdelning.
 



  





 Som servicekoordinator innebär din roll ett varierat arbete med uppgifter som garantihantering, teknisk uppföljning av vårt återförsäljarnätverk och planering samt utförande av utbildningar och projekt. Du kommer att vara en del av vårt marinserviceteam, som för närvarande består av sex medarbetare.
 



  





 Tjänsten passar bäst för en självständig och proaktiv person med god teknisk insikt och administrativa förmåga.
 



  





**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter består av:** 




  




* Garanti/reklamationshantering
* Planering och utförande av servicekurser för återförsäljare.
* Teknisk support till återförsäljare genom telefon och e-post.
* Rapportering till serviceavdelning och fabrik.



  





**Dina kvalifikationer:** 




  




* Erfarenhet av marinbranschen och servicemarknaden där,företrädesvis från en roll som innefattat kundmottagning, garantihantering samt teknisk rådgivning..
* Du behärskar både skandinaviskt språk samt engelska i tal och skrift. Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av teknisk engelska.
* Goda administrativa- och IT-kunskaper.
* God tal- och kommunikationsförmåga, särskilt för anförande vid kurser och föreläsningar.
* Förmåga att arbeta i team, samtidigt som du är självständig i dagliga uppgifter.
* Körkort, har du också erfarenhet av att navigera med båt ses det som meriterande.



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 




 På Yamaha Motor blir du en del av ett internationellt företag med ett ledande varumärke och högkvalitativa produkter. Du får konkurrenskraftiga villkor och möjlighet att utvecklas inom ett spännande område.
 



  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Starfinder och frågor om tjänsten och processen besvaras av Susanna Haglund på 076 221 67 07 eller Malin Dunder på 076 777 67 62. Tjänsten ska tillsättas hösten 2024 och sista ansökningsdag är 15 augusti. Urval kan dock komma att ske löpande så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Avtal & Ersättningar-handläggare
description:
TRR söker en Handläggare avtal och ersättningar till Nationell funktion. Avtal och ersättningar stöttar TRRs tjänstemän i omställning och i anställning, kundföretag, kundkontakter samt verksamheten internt med expertis, tillgänglighet och rätt service enligt TRRs uppdrag.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
 Som Handläggare avtal & ersättningar kommer du att arbeta med hantering, bedömning och rådgivning av inkomna ansökningar samt beslutsfattande om rätt till stöd från TRR. Du kommer att arbeta med utredningar av ärenden via telefon och mejl. Utöver detta kommer du även att besvara förfrågningar från fack, företag, tjänstemän och kollegor gällande frågor som rör omställningsavtalet och tillhörande praxis. I rollen ingår även handläggning av ärenden med beslut, bevakning och uppföljning av utbetalningar.
   

  

**Kompetenskrav**
* Akademisk utbildning, gärna inom juridik eller motsvarande
* God kunskap om arbetsmarknaden
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med telefon, mejl och ärendehanteringssystem
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med handläggning och att fatta beslut i ärenden
* Goda IT-kunskaper och vana att jobba i flera olika system
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift


 Du rapporterar till Chef för Kundcenter och Avtal & ersättningar.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 Du har en trygg och positiv personlighet som präglas av gott självledarskap och god samarbetsförmåga. Du är även noggrann, strukturerad och resultatorienterad. Då denna roll innefattar kontakt med kundföretag, kundkontakter samt omställnings- och kompetenskunder är du också en person med såväl god bedömningsförmåga som servicekänsla med god kommunikativ förmåga i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Sista ansökningsdag:** 
 Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande. Välkommen att ansöka senast den 30 juni
   

  

**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid/Tillsvidare
   

  

**Start:** 
 Omgående med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Om TRR**
 TRR arbetar för tjänstemän och arbetsgivare inom det privata näringslivet. Vi är specialister på omställning och kompetensstöd. I våra 30 000 anslutna företag arbetar drygt 1,1 miljoner tjänstemän. Genom olika tjänster och rådgivning vägleder vi företag och deras medarbetare mot ny anställning, studier eller till att starta eget företag. TRR grundades 1974 av parterna på den privata arbetsmarknaden: arbetsgivarförbunden inom Svenskt Näringsliv och fackförbunden inom PTK. TRR är en stiftelse som drivs utan vinstintresse och styrelsen består av representanter för PTK och Svenskt Näringsliv.

title: Office Administrator
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**Experience Level:** 
 Experienced Hire
   

  

**Categories**
* Corporate Services


**Location(s):**
* Moody?s Investors Service (Nordics) AB, Norrlandsgatan 20, Stockholm, 11143, SE


 Role/Responsibilities: To provide Facility and Office administration and front desk manning and coordinate with the administrative assistant for business continuity and back-up assistance
   

  

* Facility Management maintenance Responsible for making sure local office maintenance is taken care of on a daily basis, such as kitchen and coffee machine maintenance, meeting room preparations, public areas, printer rooms, etc.
* Facility Management administration Responsible for liaison with (internal) Country Manager and local Management, Real Estate Team, IT and (external) Landlord, Building/Office Access, Building/Office Services counterparts/vendors and Security and Recycling counterparts/vendors, attend to building and office issues, office space, seating and desk allocion
* Front Desk Staffing and Meeting Coordination


 Respnsible for Visitor management, such as taking care of internal and external visitors and accompanying external vendors to the office in a pleasant and professional manner, making sure desks and/or conference rooms are prepared and compliance is adhered to. Answer incoming phone calls promptly and in a pleasant and professional manner and taking care of courier requests. Assist in processing meeting requests including setting up appointments, reserving conference rooms, preparing access passes for internal visitors, arranging for teleconference numbers, refreshments, handouts etc.
   

  

* Health & Safety


 Liaise with local management to ensuring a healthy workspace, such as ergonomy, well-being, HLR
   

  

 etc.
   

  

* Travel & Entertainment Administration


 Assist in arranging travel for team members including air, rail, car service, and hotel and conference registrations taking care to be mindful of deadlines and working to ensure that the most economical options are taken advantage of. Timely and accurate preparation and submission of T&E reports for each staff member supported, ensuring that company policies have been followed and that proper and organized documentation is provided to support the report.
   

  

* Accounts Payable Administration


 Assist in Timely and accurate preparation and submission of Accounts Payable vouchers, ensuring that proper accounts are used, amounts are correct and that proper and organized documentation is provided to support the voucher.
   

  

* BackUp to Administrative Assistant


 During times of absence or leaves, act as first point of contact in administrative related tasks.
   

  

* Other May be called upon to take on additional responsibilities and/or perform other tasks as assigned.


**Qualifications**
* Experience working in a corporate environment (preferably 2-5 years)
* Working knowledge of, and skill in, the Microsoft Office Suite including Outlook, Teams, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
* Good organization skills
* Excellent manner and well-groomed appearance
* Very good verbal and written communications skills; fluency in Swedish is essential and good business English
* Ability to multi-task and adapt to shifting priorities
* Excellent attention to detail
* Strong orientation toward teamwork
* Requires moderate supervision

title: TS Field Engineer
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
**This is where you save and sustain lives**
 At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.
   

  

 Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.
   

  

 Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.
   

  

 Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.
   

  

 Baxter is seeking a
 **Field Service Engineer** 
 to join our Technical Services Team in Sweden.
   

  

 The Field Engineer is responsible for the service activity on products supplied by Baxter/Hillrom in Stockholm area. They will need to undertake their duties in compliance with assigned company procedures (e.g. Control of Service Documentation, Environmental Health & Safety).
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Install, service, repair and maintain products, distributed by Baxter/Hillrom in the defined area of responsibility as per the defined service documentation and the quality system framework.
* Establish & maintain timely customer communications & relationships, along with other key partners (e.g. team members and business units).
* Report all relevant service activity, ensuring updated and accurate service data in the service system (all work orders should be closed within the same day).
* Responsible for maintaining and documenting the assigned calibration equipment.
* Provide technical support for in-bound calls from customer & patients, document the job on the system and undertake the relevant actions.
* Maintain up-to-date technical competence in assigned products by successfully completing the relevant training and development.
* Find opportunities for new business or business growth for products & services and raise to the relevant partners (e.g. account managers, Inside Sales).
* Review KPIs regularly and adapt the working practices to ensure service level is maximised.
* Plan and perform qualified technical training to distributors, partners, and colleagues.
* Coordinate and disseminate technical updates and bulletins.
* Be the technical expert and support for customers, account managers and engineers. This includes being the technical escalation point for the designated product group.
* Raise and communicate updates to the monthly SME calls.
* Represent UKIN interests in EMEA/Global technical community.
* Provide technical feedback into contracts & tender submissions.


**Job Requirements**
* Degree, HNC/HND or equivalent level qualification in the relevant engineering field
* Practical experience within medical industry
* Good IT knowledge on general connectivity, network integration of devices, wireless protocols, mobile network technologies, software support and cyber security standards would be advantageous.
* Frequent and regular travel within the assigned geographical region in Sweden/Nordics.
* Driving license
* Fluid in Swedish and English language


**Your Next Step**
 If you like the sound of the above role, can thrive in a fast-paced working environment and are passionate about working in a learning and growth culture, then we’d love to talk to you. Please apply directly on our Online System.
   

  

**Reasonable Accommodations**
 Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**
 Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.
   

  

 129115

title: Platform DevOps Engineer
description:
Are you an ambitious DevOps Engineer eager to jump in a world of complex challenges to modernise web and globally distributed applications? We are hiring!
   

  

 Product Development at Betsson Group
   

  

 Our Product Development organisation is truly Global with cross functional teams spanning 6 Tech Hubs – Malta, Budapest, Stockholm, Tallinn, Kyiv and Athens. With nearly 600 strong professionals, the Product Development organisation is spear-headed by our CTO-CPO with all our talented Area Teams working together.
   

  

 A taster of what you will be involved with
   

  

* Working with cutting edge technology enabling our Cloud Journey
* The Platform Core team is responsible for managing Infrastructure as Code for parts of our Core Platform Layer (Kubernetes Clusters, Message Broker backends, Infrastructure tooling), providing a distributed runtime platform that ensures optimal performance of our business applications, APIs and websites
* Building our Infrastructure Platforms as self-service to our developers and providing guidance and tooling for developers to self-manage their applications cross environments
* Continuously improve and develop our platforms based on business needs. Analyse, diagnose and solve issues of efficiency performance and scale collaborating cross functional with colleagues from different teams


 Right now, we are looking to strengthen further the management of our Container Platform and Kafka Messaging Platform and looking for a DevOps engineer with strong knowledge and experience in Kubernetes administration and managing Kafka infrastructure.
   

  

 You're good at
   

  

* Experience or familiar of working with Kubernetes and cluster administration, preferably with experience with AWS EKS, Rancher RKE or in alternative Google Cloud GKE, or Azure AKS.
* Strong knowledge and experience of managing Kafka infrastructure, administration, and configuration.
* Experience of working with and managing distributed messaging systems, like multiple Kafka clusters.
* Managing Cloud Infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code using Terraform, with a good understanding of terraform modules.
* Experience working with cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) and familiar with Cloud provider services, EC2, ALBs, VPC, EKS etc.
* Experience in building systems that scale is required
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Immutable Deployments
* Familiarity with the open-source monitoring stack of Prometheus/Grafana/Loki/Jaeger.
* Ability to write scripts in Python, Bash, Powershell or similar
* Good LINUX / UNIX background
* Strong analytical / problem solving skills
* 24×7 business and On-call support


 Who We Are
   

  

 Betsson Group is one of the largest companies within the Global iGaming space and can trace our heritage as far back as the 1960’s. We’re Swedish and publicly listed too with our Operational HQ located on the Mediterranean Island of Malta.
   

  

 We strive to deliver the best customer experience in the industry. As a market leader within iGaming we offer online gaming products across 12+ jurisdictions and 20+ brands.
   

  

 You will be part of a passionate team, which is building an industry leading, scalable, multi-brand platform used by hundreds of thousands of our customers!
   

  

 What we Offer
   

  

 Much like riding a roller-coaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1900 strong, spread across 7 offices! We recognise it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
   

  

 We can offer you an environment full of ambition and passion. One day is never like the other as the only constant is change, to the better, to the greater. We strive to be the best in whatever field we choose to play on, and we make sure to have fun along the way!
   

  

* A friendly, open and humble working environment, where you will have the chance to work alongside with colleagues from all over the world
* A chance to evolve your skills together with your colleagues with various programs and initiatives
* Personal development through courses, in-house training and external certification
* Freedom with responsibility


 Challenge accepted?
   

  

**Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about**
*****By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy*****

title: Digital Communications Professional
description:
Do you have expertise in digital channels and want to grow and learn from peers in other digital platforms? Then we have the perfect opportunity for you!
   

  

 At Sandvik Group we’re now looking for three Digital Communications Professionals to join our team – focusing on delivering digital experience on our platforms and ensuring engaging and creative communication that supports our goals and initiatives. We welcome you to an inclusive, agile and fun working environment where we enable innovation and healthy collaborations.
   

  

**About Your Job**
 In this position, you manage and develop our existing digital platforms for communications and marketing – ensuring we have the appropriate functionality, structure and usability. You play a crucial role in evaluating and executing the expansion of our digital presence with new ways of communicating in the existing platforms or adding new platforms to the mix. You stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure our messaging and brand is adapted to fit the different target audiences and digital touchpoints. By orchestrating, supporting and driving optimization of all digital platforms, you enhance our digital presence. You’re responsible for creating plans and implementing measurement tools and methods to enable a data-driven way of working across digital channels.
   

  

 You cooperate across the organization to achieve agreed business and functional results, as well as lead demands from communications towards IT and other stakeholders. An important part of this role involves creating content, both written and visual, for all of our digital channels and different audiences. You actively contribute and work with the development of our current and future digital landscape internally and externally.
   

  

 You’re located at our headquarters at the World Trade Center in Stockholm, and we apply a hybrid work set-up where you can combine office work with work from another location.
   

  

**Your profile**
 We’re looking for someone with extensive experience in digital communications, data and analytics, combined with experience and curiosity in generative AI, an understanding of IT requirements, writing skills and channel management. You have a relevant degree and are a skilled content creator with the ability of transferring corporate messages and strategies into compelling content. Don’t you tick all of these boxes? No problem! We’re looking for the right personalities with expertise in some of these areas, who are eager to learn the rest from other experts in the team. We’re looking to create a team that together can deliver on the increasing demands of the digital landscape. In this position, you play a pivotal role in overseeing and optimizing various digital communication channels and projects. Acting in a global setting calls for excellent skills in English.
   

  

 Your personality is what makes us better! By combining strategic thinking, analytical skills, technical expertise and an agile mindset, you contribute to setting targets, monitoring performance and adjusting strategies as needed to achieve results. Being self-motivated, outgoing, and confident, you also know how to prioritize, creatively solve problems, and you have an eye for details. Add to this a passion for collaboration and a great ability to create networks, and you’re a perfect match for this job!
   

  

**Our culture**
 Our role is clear – through every action, every day, we make the shift and advance the world through engineering. We believe in an inclusive, equal and open-minded culture, and we nurture our diversities to form a solid foundation for achieving great results. Add fair and rewarding benefits, as well as many different career options. Are you intrigued? Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook page to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact
   

  

 Edvard Bergström, Vice President Corporate Communications Relations and Productions, +46 (0)70-993 83 11, edvard.bergstrom@sandvik.com
   

  

 Cristina Kapp, Vice President Corporate Communications & Brand, +46 (0)72-143 95 62, cristina.kapp@sandvik.com
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

 Kristina Sundell, Unionen, +46 (0)70 211 64 00
   

  

 Erik Knebel, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70 340 47 03
   

  

 Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55
   

  

 Recruitment Specialists: Lisbeth Häggström and Tanja Benavides
   

  

**How To Apply**
 This recruitment has an ongoing selection process, please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than August 10, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0067834.
   

  

 At Sandvik, we value a healthy work-life balance and will be away on summer vacation. Therefore, it can be difficult to reach us, and the recruitment process might take longer than usual.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.nordic@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41* 
*,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.*

title: BI Engineer to Husqvarna
description:
Are you a passionate Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer eager to join Husqvarna's dynamic Analytics Team? We seek someone to develop reporting systems and insightful data analysis for better decision-making, working with data integration and modeling while supporting front-end development. If you have expertise in data modeling, Power BI, and Azure Data Services, along with a solution-oriented mindset and strong communication skills, this role is for you!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Husqvarna
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, Remote in Sweden
 



  

**Start date :**
 2024-06-03 -2024-12-31
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 We are looking for an Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer to be part of the Analytics Team at Husqvarna. The Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer works collaboratively with end users to develop reporting systems that provide accessible information for decision-making. The BI Engineer uses warehouse data and other data sources to solve organizational problems through reports, analysis and data visualization. The BI Engineer will provide data analytics expertise with emphasis on data design, access, usage, security and quality of information assets.
 


  


  

**Work Tasks**



  

  
* The role is focused on back-end development: Ingest, integrate and analyze data and build data models
  
* The role will support front-end development
  
* Will to some degree include communication with the business and gather requirements
  
* Develop and implement effective business analytics solutions that drive improved decision making, efficiency and performance
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Documented Expert Level Data Modelling Skills; 3rd normal form / Data Vault / Dimensional modelling
  
* Understanding of how to build efficient models for Power BI
  
* Good knowledge of Data Analysis Expressions (DAX)
  
* Experience of working with Development in Distributed Version Control (GIT)
  
* Snowflake and DBT ​
  
* Azure Data Services, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Analytics Services​
  
* Azure DevOps with GIT​
  
* Microsoft BI-stack including Power-BI and Microsoft SQL
  
* Proficiency in English, with effective communication skills both in writing and speaking
  


  


  

**Soft skills:**



  

  
* Good collaboration and communication skills
  
* Positive attitude – “will do” attitude
  
* Solution oriented mindset with focus on high quality deliverables
  
* Structured in Way of working
  
* Self Driven
  
* Ability to be keep updated on relevant technology
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.

title: Backend-utvecklare till Crediflow!
description:
Är du en erfaren backend-utvecklare med kunskap inom C#? Vill du till ett familjärt bolag som ligger i framkant inom sitt område? Trivs du bra i en prestigelös arbetsmiljö? Då vill vi höra från dig!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Crediflow AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Täby
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Crediflow är en ledande aktör som levererar lösningar inom e-faktura och EDI till företag och myndigheter. Du erbjuds en spännande tjänst på ett företag som ligger i framkant inom sitt område. Idag hanterar Crediflow en stor del av alla fakturor som skickas och tas emot i Norden och andra länder.
   

 Sedan start har ambitionen varit att förenkla och effektivisera företagsprocesser, genom att förenkla utbytet av elektroniska dokument. Oavsett vem kunden vill skicka till eller ta emot ifrån erbjuder Crediflow ett enkelt och effektivt sätt att hantera företagens dokumentflöden på – hela vägen från order till betalning. Crediflows anpassningsbara och skalbara lösningar innefattar bästa praxis inom logistik, ekonomi och IT.
 


  


 I rollen som Backend-utvecklare är du en del av ett team med utvecklare i Helsingborg och Stockholm. Du blir en nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av Crediflows ledande molntjänst. Tjänsten innebär också att lyssna in och förstå verksamhetens behov och komma med förslag på lösningar och ändringar, för att sedan vara med och skapa dessa. Har du dessutom ett intresse och teknisk förståelse kring AI finns stora möjligheter att påverka företagets utveckling och användning inom detta framåt.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckling i C# i cloudbaserad miljö
  
* Skapa och förbättra ramverk i koden
  
* Vara delaktig i beslut rörande drift och utveckling av Crediflows cloudbaserade system
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har goda erfarenhet från C#, gärna inom produktutveckling
  
* Har erfarenhet och god förståelse för development patterns och strukturdesign
  
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta och optimera molnbaserade tjänster för att skapa effektiva och pålitliga system
  


  


  

**Det är även meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av Python (helst inom AI) och frontendutveckling (t.ex angular)
  
* Erfarenhet inom design och optimering av databaser och SQL
  
* Erfarenhet från verksamhet med intensiva transaktionsflöden
  
* Erfarenhet av Agila arbetssätt
  


  


 I rollen som backend utvecklare kommer du själv få testa din kod, vilket sätter krav på en noggrannhet och en självkritisk förmåga. Som person ser vi att du är självgående och tycker om att se lösningar på problem.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Crediflow AB**

 Läs mer om Crediflow här !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Crediflow AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Elin Sjösten eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på ste03@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105141

title: Fullstack developer to big bank in Stockholm!
description:
Are you excited about tackling complex technical challenges in a major bank? Join an innovative IT team in Stockholm to enhance the banks fraud monitoring systems. We’re seeking talented fullstack developers eager to make a significant impact in a dynamic and supportive environment. Apply today - the position start as soon as possible!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, long term assignment
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 The role involves working with a complex technical setup, understanding and documenting the entire solution, and ensuring the smooth integration of various components. You will work closely with other team members to handle incidents, install applications and maintain the infrastructure.
 


  


 In the role you will work with complex technical setups, dive into configurations, and understand how everything fits together. You will document the entire solution, including its setup, configuration, and how components interact and depend on each other to handle incidents and install applications. Due to this, the role requires someone who are interested in a mix of software development and infrastructure, who want to focus on configuration management and scripting.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* The opportunity to become part of a large international company at the forefront of technology.
  
* An incredible opportunity to take your next step in your IT career, learn and grow alongside skilled colleagues in an exciting technical environment.
  
* The chance to develop internally and increase your expertise in banking and finance.
  
* A dedicated consultant manager from Academic Work who will support and coach you in your future career. This is a long-term assignment through Academic Work with the possibility of direct recruitment by the bank if all parties are satisfied with the cooperation in the future.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Manage and enhance the banks internal fraud monitoring systems and communication oversight.
  
* Collaborate with IT team to handle and implement software solutions, ensuring better control and management.
  
* Document technical configurations and solutions, understanding the setup and integration of complex systems.
  
* Perform coding tasks, configuration management, and scripting to support and maintain advanced infrastructure components.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Academic background in
   

**Computer Science or Information Technology**
 , or other relevant education within IT
  
* Documented software development and infrastructure knowledge, from previous roles, projects/hobby or internship
  
* Good knowledge with Linux, Oracle, SQL, and Kubernetes
  
* Good knowledge of an object oriented programming language
  
* Ability to document technical solutions and understand system configurations
  
* Knowledge of scripting and configuration management
  
* Fluent in english
  
* Swedish citizenship or a valid work permit enabling immediate start in the position.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Either a testing background, a infrastructure background or a developer background
  
* Experience from a tech stack covering: Elasticsearch, YML, MQ, Prometheus/Grafana, LogI, encryption technologies and AWS.
   

 Knowledge can be gained through education, experience or self-taught.
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Self-Sufficient
  
* ProblemSolver
  
* ResultsOriented
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.

title: Modern Workplace Engineer | Microsoft 365
description:
Unlock the potential of Microsoft 365 as a visionary engineer, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions. Embrace continuous learning and collaborate with global teams to shape the future of technology-driven excellence. Join us at Avanade, where creativity, innovation, and career growth thrive.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Are you passionate about helping partners realize the value of a Modern Workplace? So are we!
   

  

 Avanade Sweden is looking for a Modern Workplace Engineer who will use their experience in Microsoft 365 suite including collaboration, device management, and security components to provide a truly cost-efficient, responsive, and secure evergreen Modern Workplace to our valued clients. You thrive on transforming business challenges into powerful solutions, and your attention to detail sets you apart. Embrace your passion for continuous learning and seize the opportunity to deliver top-tier results under pressure. Join us as we shape the future with technology-driven excellence!
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Skills And Experiences**
 You have previous experience with:
   

  

* Microsoft 365
* Collaboration tools such as SharePoint online, Teams
* Modern Device management with Intune/SCCM
* Understanding of security components in Entra ID, Purview and Defender suite
* Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop
* Windows 11 and mobile operating systems


 Office 365
   

  

* Other experience includes:
* PowerShell and other scripting language
* Up-to-date knowledge of Microsoft products


**About You**
 You’re a natural communicator who wants to help our partners on their Modern Workplace journey. You will help improve employee mobility, efficiency, teamwork, and security demonstrating your experience in Microsoft 365 suite. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Embrace challenges with a keen intellect and a thirst for knowledge.
* Collaborate seamlessly, fostering open and effective communication.
* Embrace creativity and explore groundbreaking solutions.
* Stay ahead of the curve, anticipating what lies ahead and adapting to the latest advancements


**What You'll Do**
 As a
 *Modern Workplace Engineer* 
 , your focus is on Workplace Services including desktop solutions, collaboration technologies, Voice solutions and enablement of secure remote working environments.
   

  

 Day-to-day, you will make upgrades, migrations, and evergreen scenarios. You translate business requirements into technical solutions using Microsoft 365 products, driving their implementations in enterprise environments. You collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions, manage task backlog for continuous improvement and share best-practices with Global Avanade Team members. Additionally, you apply your expertise in technical and consulting knowledge to advise clients on accurate governance to ensure stability, and to enable them to evolve their environments to support changing business requirements.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about the types of projects our Modern Workplace team works on check out these case studies:
   

  

* Why now is the time to modernize your communications capabilities
* Workplace experience: Why evergreen is everything


 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

* Avanade Insights – exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
* Inside Avanade – explore what life is like working at Avanade


**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


**Benefits**
 Find out more about some of our benefits here.
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look! T
 **ogether we do what matters** 
 .
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Försäljningschef - Hemköp
description:
**Om Hemköp:**
* Hemköp fokuserar på glädjen för mat som är god, prisvärd och hållbar. Med ett brett sortiment inspirerar Hemköp till matglädje och trygghet i vardagen
* Det finns över 200 butiker i Sverige, i Hemköps organisation ingår även Tempo med cirka 130 butiker. Med fokus på färskvaror och kundmöten som guidar och inspirerar ska kundens förväntningar överträffas, både i butik och digitalt
* På Hemköp är det högt till tak och man delar med sig av kunskap, växer och utvecklas tillsammans. Bolaget är måna om att stödja och uppmuntra medarbetare och erbjuder löpande utveckling och ny kunskap
* För Hemköp är mångfald en styrka. Medarbetarnas kunskaper, kompetenser och perspektiv skapar nya möjligheter och bättre beslut


**Övergripande arbetsuppgifter**
 I rollen som Försäljningschef spelar du en avgörande roll i Hemköps fortsatta resa mot tillväxt och utveckling. Du leder försäljningsorganisationen med ansvar för försäljning, bruttovinst och cirka 30 medarbetare. Som en del av företagsledningen utgör du en nyckelroll både i att fortsätta utveckla den strategiska riktningen och sätta målen för 2030, samt för att konkretisera och genomföra de planer som ska leda Hemköp dit.
   

  

**Strategiskt leda, driva och utveckla försäljningen**
* Ansvara för plan, budget och roadmap för volym- och marginalökningar
* Implementera erbjudande-, kund- och kanalstrategi; utveckla kunderbjudanden med marknadsrådet
* Säkra ansvar, uppföljning och styrning mellan egenägda/franchise butiker och e-handel
* Utveckla kundorienterat sortiment, kampanjer och prisstrategier
* Skapa samarbeten och partnerskap för att öka försäljningen i butiker
* Omvärlds- och konkurrensbevakning
* Bidra till Hemköps förändringsresa och lönsam tillväxt som medlem i företagsledningen
* Förhandla avtal och marknadsinvesteringar med leverantörer


**Struktur, arbetssätt och kravställning**
* Skapa och utveckla framgångsrik struktur, metodik och effektiva arbetssätt
* Kravställare och beställare mot Dagab och koncernfunktioner (IT, sortiment, logistik)


**Ledarskap**
* Leda den kommersiella organisationen på 30 FTE.
* Utveckla och följa upp chefer och medarbetare för att säkerställa kompetens och förmåga att nå mål och strategi för 2025 och mot 2030
* Driva beteendeförändring för att skapa rätt ledarkultur och affärsmannaskap


**Din profil**
 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

* Förmåga att arbeta på hög strategisk och analytisk nivå, samt omsätta strategin till genomförande i praktiken
* Inspirerande och förändringsdriven ledare med förmåga att stärka teamet
* Högt affärsmannaskap och förmåga att driva förändring
* Förtroendeskapande och skicklig på att hantera många olika intressenter
* Erfarenhet och/eller passion för mat


**Formella kriterier**
* Civilingenjör, Civilekonom eller motsvarande
* 10 + års erfarenhet av försäljning i varierande roller, varav 5+ års erfarenhet av ledarskap (leda andra chefer)
* God förståelse för dagligvaruhandeln
* Bevisad erfarenhet av förändringsledning med tydliga resultat
* Erfarenhet av att sätta strategi, skapa plan och styrning för genomförande och uppföljning
* Erfarenhet av ekonomi- och budgetansvar
* Förhandlingsvana
* Svenska och engelska obehindrat i tal och skrift
* Systemkunskap: BI, CRM, SAP


 Ansökan I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Navigio. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten, hör av dig till Vilgot Bergmark på vilgot.bergmark@navigio.se. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast den 28e juni 2024. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande varpå tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

title: Business Expert - Component and Quotation Beauty Flow
description:
**Company Description**
 H&M Group is one of the biggest fashion companies in the world. We are a family of brands, driven by our mission to make a sustainable lifestyle an option for the many. With our customers at heart, we offer fashion, design, and services to millions of customers every day.
   

  

 We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong.
   

  

 Be yourself & more at H&M.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are now looking for a
 **Business Expert for the Component & Quotation Flow Beauty team, focusing on product quotation and data analysis.**
**About The Component & Quotation Flow Beauty Team**
 The team is part of the Component & Quotation Value Stream within Production Processes and Tech Development, with a mission to digitalize the way of working with the beauty assortment. You will play a key role in making history, as we are developing a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system tailored to H&M Group’s beauty needs. The team operates agilely, swiftly adapting to changes and collaborating with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Business Expert, you will act as a Requirement Analyst or Business Analyst, understanding and meeting end-user needs by collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Business Experts, Product Managers, engineers, and stakeholders, to ensure business value. Key tasks include identifying and prioritizing critical requirements for the Component & Quotation Flow Beauty roadmap. Additionally, you will be responsible for creating data insights to drive informed decision-making and enhance product value.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Your responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:
   

  

* Drive the beauty product quotation processes
* Enhance product value for end-users
* Translate business requirements into actionable product features and user stories
* Collect and analyze data to improve user experience, create insights to support business actions
* Optimize existing business processes through data and user insights
* Ensure alignment of product deliverables with business objectives via User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
* Foster continuous collaboration between stakeholders to integrate business and technology
* Conduct training sessions to engage and motivate the team and stakeholders


**Qualifications**
 You and your product team will operate on both operational and strategic levels to pinpoint areas for potential improvement. To excel in this role, we value the following qualifications:
   

  

* Experience with product quotation
* Understanding the complexity of beauty product development is beneficial
* Having a background in data analysis would be preferred
* Exceptional communication and relationship-building skills
* Experience in managing diverse stakeholders
* Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize tasks effectively
* Experience in digital product development and problem-solving
* Ability to develop business cases aligned with product value propositions
* Flexibility and adaptability to respond rapidly to changes
* Experience with Jira & Confluence is beneficial
* Experience with Scrum ceremonies; Scrum Master certification is a plus.


**Additional Information**
**Job Application**
 Ready to make your mark in the world of tech and beauty? The role is open for Europe from while being a part of one of the most impactful teams.
   

  

 If your experience, skills, and ambitions, align with our values, we encourage you to apply for this exciting full-time opportunity as soon as possible or latest
 **25th of June 2024** 
 . Simply attach your resume in ENGLISH – no need for a cover letter.
   

  

 We are eagerly anticipating your application!
   

  

*Diversity, Inclusion, and Innovation*
*At H&M Group, we're deeply committed to fostering a Diverse & Inclusive environment. We actively seek out qualified candidates regardless of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.*
*Our commitment to an inclusive workplace drives our dynamic and forward-thinking culture. Regardless of your background, origin, or preferences, your application is warmly welcomed. We value diverse perspectives and skills, and every applicant contributes to our vibrant, creative community. Join us and be part of the future we're building.*
**Our Offer**
 At H&M Group, you're not just joining a team – you're joining a value-driven culture and an expansive tech network. Enjoy perks like staff discount cards, flexible work arrangements, wellness benefits, parental support, and more. Here, you're encouraged to be yourself, experiment, and chart your growth path. As you flourish, so do we, with opportunities to create tangible impacts and shape the future.

title: Software Engineer
description:
BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. In fact, our market share is higher than all our competitors’ combined. Today, we manufacture close to 2,000 spreaders of all types every year and our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports world- wide.
   

  

 BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.
   

  

 More information about BROMMA can be found on www.bromma.com
   

  

****Do you want to make your next move count? With us, you can****
 At Bromma, we're passionate about driving innovation to solve some of the most challenging problems in our industry. Our team is dedicated to creating top-notch software solutions that make a real difference in the world. We're looking for a talented
 **Software Engineer** 
 to join our dynamic team and help us push the boundaries of what's possible.
   

  

****Main tasks and responsibilities****
* Invent, design and implement new features and products within Bromma’s Integrated Solution segment
* Develop the spreader control software platform
* Design and develop software in advanced customer projects
* Support other departments in complicated software issues
* Develop and maintain technical expertise for innovations and progress in research and science
* Plan, design, and conduct research projects according to established scientific methods, principles, and theories to solve problems, improve or generate new products
* Responsible for new development of the Bromma control system software platform.


****What you’ll need to succeed****
 Education
   

  

  

* MSc in Engineering.


**Experience**
* At least 5 years of relevant business / product experience
* Software development, PLC languages and C-like languages
* Knowledge and experience in object oriented programming.


 Competencies:
   

  

  

* Self driven, customer oriented and good business awareness
* Problem solving mentality-Ability to work with people of diverse background
* A team player with excellent interpersonal skills, written as well as oral communication
* A self-starter who is driven, resourceful and creative in contributing with improvement ideas
* Good judgement to prioritise between available resources, profitability requirements and market needs
* Fluent in English, writing and speaking.


****You will be part of****
 We believe in our people as it is our people who really make the difference. We always work in close collaboration with our customers, deliver on our promises and never walk away no matter how big the challenge. We succeed because we do it together.
   

  

 With us, you will have the opportunity to realise your potential and become an important member of our global team.
   

  

 More benefits:
   

  

 We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package geared to boost health and wellbeing
   

  

 All our employees are offered comprehensive Learning & Development opportunities, annual development
   

  

 plan and career progression opportunities
   

  

 In most of our positions, you have flexible working hours and hybrid work (combination of remote work and
   

  

 on-site work)
   

  

 At Kalmar, you will join a truly international working environment and support making global trade faster,
   

  

 smarter and more sustainable - smarter cargo flow for a better everyday.
   

  

****Interested to join?****
 For further information please contact Nils Breitholtz, Manager, Electrical Control System by email at nils.breitholtz@bromma.com
   

  

 If you are excited about this opportunity, please submit your application by 30.06.2024.
   

  

 Please note that the recruitment process for this position is coordinated by our HR team part of Kalmar Business Services based in Bulgaria.
   

  

 Please note that the interview process may begin before the closing date of the job posting.
   

  

 Bromma is part of Cargotec. Cargotec's (Nasdaq Helsinki: CGCBV) sales in 2023 totalled approximately EUR 4.6 billion and it employs around 11,400 people. www.cargotec.com

title: Security Solution Architect
description:
**Your role as a Security Solution Architect**
 A Solution Architect within Atos primarily acts as the technical commercial expert in bid or development projects, translating customer requirements into a solution for a subset of the overall solution. Secondarily a Solution Architect assists Strategy and Growth with regards to new propositions, PoC’s and MvP’s and support current portfolio items. As such, the Cloud Security Solution Architect performs several activities. Willingness to travel is essential.
   

  

**Your Day-to-day Responsibilities Will Include**
**COMMERCIAL CONTRIBUTES TO THE DEAL OR PROJECT**
* Actively engages with the customer, proving that Atos has the required expertise and building a relationship with the customer based on trust and knowledge.
* Spots new business opportunities alone or together with other members of the commercial team and structures these by providing proper guidance (e.g., roadmaps, demo sessions, presentations, etc.)
* Creates commercial texts and calculations for proposals and provides input to contract, SLA or project.


**TECHNICAL DESIGN SOLUTION IN AREA OF EXPERTISE**
* Primarily participates in (or sometimes leads) the solution process.
* Designs and calculates a consistent sub-set of the overall solution within the area of expertise, its starting points and conditions.
* Advises on risks of a chosen architecture/ technology including possible risk mitigations.
* Proactively identifies opportunities towards the customer to improve the proposed solution and/or to improve Atos’s profitability or serviceability.
* Provides input to Head of Strategy & Growth, (Sub) Business line manager or the Solution Manager/Transition Manager on the aspects within the project.


**COORDINATIVE ALIGN WITH TEAM**
* Align the proposed technical architecture with portfolio and ensures a good fit with the overall solution towards the customer.
* Normally participates in multiple solution teams, which in turn are part of bid or project teams. For bids that require only one or two areas of expertise a Solution Architect may act as the Solution Manager
* Obtains commitment from involved delivery parties on the assigned to scope of services, costs, risks, and timing.
* Proactively teams with Head of Strategy & Growth, (Sub) Business line manager and Portfolio Management to develop new customer focused propositions and maintain current portfolio within area of expertise.


**FINANCIAL GET PROFITABLE BUSINESS**
* Determines the solution costs within the area of expertise.
* Identifies financial risks and proposes steps to mitigate these risks.
* Identifies opportunities and proposes steps to realize these opportunities.
* Provides input on costs to the financial engineer and advises the financial engineer on mapping the Atos pricing model to customer requested pricing model.


**PORTFOLIO IMPROVE OUR OFFERINGS**
* Support Head of Strategy and Growth in developing new and maintaining existing portfolio materials
* Advises Head of Strategy and Growth on new technical developments within area of expertise
* Shares findings on usability of our portfolio with Head of Strategy and Growth to improve, adjust or redefine our offerings.
* Write or provide input to white papers/ publications and other commercial material. Also assists in Marketing activities.


**COMPETENCE SEEK AND SHARE KNOWLEDGE**
* Provide feedback of bid results and experiences towards other team members and management
* Participate and/or provide input to the win/loss review.
* Proactively engage with staff in transition/delivery to discuss experiences with the aim to improve our bids.
* Extend current expertise and seeking new areas of expertise in line with customer demand, market and portfolio developments.


**Skills We'd Like You To Have**
* Bachelor/ Master Degree in IT, Computer Sience, Electronics, Math or Physics
* At least 3 - 5 years of experience in IT (cyber) security with proven experience in cyber security and recovery technology with various vendors. Experience in the areas SIEM, SOC, IPS/IDS.
* Experience with security solutions in cloud deployments in AWS and/or Azure
* Experience with Cyber Recovery products such as PowerProtect Cyber Recovery is considered favorable.
* Preferably you are SSCP and/or CISSP certified,
* Understanding of IT architecture (e.g., TOGAF), Agile, Scrum
* Experience with IT (outsourcing) business
* Excellent communicative skills, persuasive, influential in presenting plans and ideas
* Fluent in English
* Experience with working in a commercial environment


**We offer**
* A competative salary and mobility budget
* Agreed insurances and benefits according to collective agreement Teknikavtalet
* Remote working environment
* For a better work-life balance, flexible working hours can be arranged in discussion with your manager.
* Possibilities for trainings and professional career advancement
* Exciting career opportunities both locally and internationally
* A personal development plan that is built together with your manager.
* A casual work environment with results-oriented colleagues all over the world.


 At Atos our ambition is to be a diverse and inclusive company where people are truly free to be themselves. They can thrive, achieve their personal goals, and innovate without limitations.We welcome everyone to apply.
   

  

 We offer friendly family, flexible working arrangements with forums and inclusive facilities to support our staff.

title: Mechanical Design Engineer to Echandia!
description:
Are you a passionate Mechanical Engineer ready to make waves in sustainable technology? Echandia is on the lookout for a dynamic individual to join their innovative team. As a crucial member, you'll be at the forefront of designing cutting-edge battery systems for the marine environment.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Echandia Marine AB
 



  

**City :**
 Solna
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 By agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Echandia develops and manufactures heavy-duty energy storage systems for ships and other large-scale applications, focusing on providing reliable, durable, and economically viable solutions for electrification in the maritime industry. Echandia has done this successfully since 2018, when they delivered the battery systems for several award-winning vessel designs. They are now expanding to be able keep up with increasing demand and are looking for new energetic talent with a can-do-attitude.
 


  


 They are now seeking a talented Mechanical Engineer to join their innovative team. As a key contributor, you will play a crucial role in the design and development of cutting-edge battery system for the marine environment. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving the success of their projects and ensuring their products meet the highest standards of quality and reliability. As part of Echandias company's commitment to professional growth, this role offers excellent opportunities for advancement and skill development. You will have the chance to work on challenging development projects, and collaborate with industry experts within the energy storage system space. Joining Echandia means becoming part of a dynamic team that is revolutionizing the sustainable transportation sector. If you are a driven and passionate Mechanical Engineer with a strong technical background, we invite you to apply and be part of our vision to shape the future of electric marine transportation.
 


  


 This is a consultant assignment, which means you will be employed as a consultant by Academic Work. The assigment is long term and the ambition is to be recruited by Echandia.
 


  


 As a Mechanical Design Engineer your primary responsibilites are:
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify product requirements and develop design concepts.
  
* Create detailed 3D models, drawings, and specifications using CAD software.
  
* Conduct testing and analysis to validate product design and performance.
  
* Design-for-manufacturing (DFM) and Design-for-assembly (DFA).
  
* Evaluate and recommend materials, components, and suppliers to optimize product performance and cost.
  
* Work with quality control team to ensure products meet industry standards and safety regulations.
  
* Develop and maintain technical documentation for all designs and testing procedures.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Bachelor's degree (or higher) in Mechanical Engineering or related field.
  
* Proven experience in product design and development, preferably in the manufacturing industry. (+3 years)
  
* Proficiency with modern CAD software.
  
* Strong understanding of mechanical systems, materials, and manufacturing processes.
  
* Basic understanding of electrical systems.
  
* Ability to analyze and interpret technical data and specifications.
  
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English.
  
* Familiarity with working with sheet metal design.
  
* Strong technical writing skills.
  
* Experience within a Swedish company
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience in Inventor
  
* Experience with battery systems and/or other dynamic DC-systems
  
* Fluency in Swedish.
  
* Experience from a multi-cultural environment
  
* Experience with finite element analysis and fluid mechanics
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Echandia Marine AB**

 Want to read more about Echandia , look no further!
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Erik Örtegren or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sts02@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15102259

title: Customer Support Associate & Colourist
description:
**About Klint**
 Klint is the fastest growing consumer paint brand in the Nordics, inspiring and guiding people to decorate their homes with innovative products and beautiful design. Our vision is a world where everyone can create the home of their dreams in a sustainable way, a vision we will pursue until we are the #1 global home decor brand.
   

  

 Our first key product innovations are hand-painted adhesive paint samples ("Swatches"), which yield a 100% colour accuracy, save 98% of the paint used when trying out colours for a room, and simplify the colour selection process for our customers. Our second key product innovation is a new type of flexible packaging for paint in the form of a transparent and recyclable paint bag.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Product Team at Klint is responsible for customer support, providing colour advisory to our customers, and supporting other team members with ideas and suggestions on how to improve the customer journey - making it even more fun and beautiful to decorate your home.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are hiring a Customer Support Associate to help our customers in the Nordics You will be the main touchpoint for all customer inquiries and help customer directly via e-mail, chat and SoMe channels. In addition, you will be provided an education and introduction into colour theory at Klint, in order to eventually also be able to take on the role as a colourist, providing colour advise to our customers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Full responsibility for customer support
* Providing colour advisory to our customers based on Klint colour theory
* Help develop and improve all customer support software we use
* Coordinate with the Operations team on big and small issues to ensure a great customer experience


 Who we think you are
   

  

* You have high agency - meaning you naturally figure out and solve problems on your own
* You love interior design
* You are interested in colour theory and how colours can transform the experience of an interior space
* You love being given clear goals, a high level of responsibility and autonomy, and then deliver on your goals
* You want to build a global home decor brand to lead the way in sustainable interior design
* You know how to really help and support someone, even when they might not know what they need themselves


**Minimum Requirements**
* 1-3 years of working experience in similar roles is positive, but not required


**Compensation**
* Full-time salary
* 70% employee discount on all products on klint.com


 Apply now
   

  

**Apply via the Hub** 
 with a
 **CV,** 
 and let us know what you think you will like about the role
 **.**

title: IPT Analyst (temporary position)
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world's most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we're working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world's biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 The
 *In Process Testing Analyst* 
 (IPT) is responsible for performing in process testing of our PCR products produced on our automated assembly lines to ensure patient safety. The results from performed tests are compiled and transferred to documents, programs, and databases.  The work environment in the IPT lab is very dynamic, and you will work in a team of high performing analysts.
   

  

**This is a temporary position the until summer of 2025.**
 The role works
 **5-shifts** 
 , meaning that you will work a total of 19 shifts in a continuous schedule of 5 weeks. The shifts include 5 day shifts, 5 evening shifts, 5 night shifts and 4 week-end shifts (2 daytime and 2 night time) with several days of rest in between the change from day/evening/night shifts.
   

  

 Are you quality oriented and have a passion for laboratory work? Then you might be the one that we are looking for! Cepheid is a growing company and the Solna site offers great development opportunities within quality, R&D, engineering, project management and people management.
   

  

 This position is part of the quality organization (Product Quality Control) and will be located in Solna, Stockholm, Sweden. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will Have The Opportunity To**
* Develop and implement testing, sampling and inspection procedures on raw materials, equipment, in-process materials, and/or finished products in the lab.
* Ensure that product specifications and company / regulatory requirements are met.
* Investigate and troubleshoot functionality and performance problems.
* Recommends corrective action when appropriate.
* Monitor and execute on-site equipment and tools calibration.


**The Essential Requirements Of The Job Include**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree within Life Science or related with 0 years of experience OR High School degree (or equivalent experience) with 2-4 years of related work experience OR Technical Trade Degree with 1-2 years of work experience within laboratory work or related industry.
* Fluent level of Swedish and English.


**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**
* laboratory work with a strong quality focus.
* real time PCR.
* working with SOPs.


 At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow's science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what's next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Fullstack Developer to Tech Trading FX Sales team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is a leading financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a developer you will be a member of a small team consisting of developers, testers, a UX designer, Scrum Master and a product owner. The team is a part of the FX (Foreign Exchange) that develop solutionsfor both internal and external traders.
   

  

 In this role you will be working with coding languages like JavaScript and Java, and frameworks like Angular, Spring Boot, NodeJS, Git, Agile, Kubernetes and Docker. You will have a close cooperation with the business side throughout the software development lifecycle.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* Minimum 2-3 years working experience
* Relevant degree in computer science or equivalent
* You have good programming skills in JavaScript and Java
* Knowledge of Docker is an advantage


 As a person we believe that you are passionate about development, really enjoys coding and eager to constantly learn and develop new skills. You take pride in delivering clean, efficient, maintainable, and tested code. You are driven, structured and positive as a person and you have a strong sense of responsibility and commitment. As a team player we see that you contribute to the social culture and genuinely want to have fun at your workplace together with your colleagues. Its meriting if you have knowledge or interest in foreign exchange or trading in general and can communicate in both English and Swedish.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We offer many great benefits to our employees, some of these benefits are a health care allowance, lifestyle allowance, several discounts and offers via Benify as well as discounts on banking services. We also have several restaurants at the premises and a fully equipped gym with gym classes and sports teams.
   

  

* You will get new skills and learn both on the technical side but also FX and finance.
* Be part of shaping SEB FX’s future offering and business
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Part of a Social team who likes to have fun during work
* Work life balance with a hybrid setup.


**Learn More About Working At SEB Www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. If you don’t tick all the boxes, we would gladly see that you apply anyway, we value personality as well as skillset.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of April 2024. If you have questions about the position please contact Martin Götze, Team Manager for FX Sales at mailto:martin.gotze@seb.se

title: Program Manager, Imaging
description:
**Job Description**
**Job Description**
 The Imaging Project Manager is our trusted point of contact for local teams, defining and resolving medium to complex problems supporting a diverse set of local teams Woltwide. Supporting country teams OKRs and data driven projects, you will cross the finish line demonstrating the impact of implemented solutions with data. You are capable of working independently to achieve results within a diverse group of stakeholders influencing multiple teams. Limited travel will be required.
   

  

**Role background**
 Wolt is a Finnish technology company and we’re best known for our food & retail delivery platform. We’ve grown significantly in the last three years, expanding our operations from just four countries across the Nordics, to 25 countries across Europe and Asia today as well as being acquired by Door Dash from America completing our trip around the globe.
   

  

 Wolt’s Global Imaging team is growing to build robust processes and distribute critical information at scale. We have opened a new position on our Imaging team for an experienced Project Manager. In this role you will be responsible for stakeholder trust and alignment with best practices across all of our local imaging teams. You will be a critical member with daily touch points to the local teams supporting their KPIs with best in class processes and resolving issues at a higher, Woltwide core level. You will be reporting to our Director of Imaging Operations with Sr. Leadership visibility daily. Your position will help to shape the business with varying projects and responsibilities playing a critical role in the way our site interacts with the customer every day.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
**What you’ll be doing**
* KPI development / ownership / goal attainment
* Playbook documentation, rollout and adherence to processes
* Weekly / Monthly reporting of all KPIs and OKRs
* New verticals / county launch ownership for Imaging
* Build and execute training materials for imaging tools, procedures, and software.
* Create communication plans for new process / tool rollouts
* Support local teams and 3P providers to plan and execute local Imaging projects.
* Style Guide and Playbook updates / creation / ownership
* Collaborating directly with 3P vendors to support Imaging team requirements and analysis of vendors
* Responsible for spot-checking local markets ensuring images meet required quality standards.


**Required Our humble expectations**
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Project Management
* English language fluency both written and spoken
* Experience working across multiple teams / disciplines, preferably internationally
* Proficiency with standard tools such as Looker, Slack, Google Drives, Monday.com,
* Proficient creating and analyzing lean operational performance metrics
* Experience influencing a team
* Expertise to organize information in relevant tools


**Next Steps**
**Our offering to you**
* Lots of room to build the direction of product management at Wolt, with a global impact!
* You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin or Stockholm. You have the chance to decide the ways of working - a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the locations above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
* In addition to our country-specific benefits, our compensation package includes a monthly salary based on your expertise and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie. 🚀
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work. 🤩


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realise you really, really want to join us!
