* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities with different stakeholders.


* Familiarity with .Net or similar technologies
* Ability to lead and guide technical teams.
* You will work with a team in Malaysia so you should be able to work well over teams.







**Outcome** 
 : Deliver a scalable, reliable, and efficient system that integrates seamlessly with the business processes, enhancing overall productivity and achieving the strategic objectives of the organization.
 







**Language skills:** 




 English and Swedish
 







  





  





  





**Om oss** 




**Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.
   

 Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.**
*Läs vidare på* 
*www.senterprise.se*

title: CUSTOMER ANALYST
description:
**Do you want to take SAS customer analytics to the next level?**
 Welcome to SAS and the customer analytics team! We are a part of SAS Commercial and responsible for analyzing marketing and customer data to better understand and predict our customers’ needs and behavior. We are now looking for two customer analysts that will be part of SAS’s analytics team and play an important role in our ambition to create a world-class customer experience.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
 As a Customer Analyst, you will be part of a cross-functional team who is responsible for SAS Marketing and CRM communication. You will provide analysis of customer behaviors, insights and knowledge of customers’ response and predict future actions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities And Tasks**
* Evaluate marketing campaigns and CRM communication to give insights and recommendations on how to maximize the effect of those.
* Perform analysis and create basis for decisions on e.g. creation of new automated campaigns and personalization measures.
* Help optimize and personalize customer communication in omni-channel to maximize customer experience.
* Define and set up customer segmentation.
* Create scripts and jobs in our data warehouse to gather data needed for target groups and perform analysis.
* Evaluate, test, build and maintain scoring models and target groups to maximize customer experience and the effect of marketing initiatives.


**Qualifications And Requirements**
* Master’s degree in relevant field such as Business administration, Economics or Statistics.
* Minimum 3 years of relevant work experience.
* Strong SQL skills.
* Experience working with CRM and/or Data Analytics.
* Experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud will be considered a big plus.
* Experience from working with analysis in a digital media context (e.g. with Google Analytics/BigQuery or similar platform).
* Knowledge in data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau).


 As a person we believe that you have the ability to see the big picture, while you are accurate and can secure details. You are result-oriented, dedicated, reliable in delivery and have an ability to independently run and lead projects. Furthermore, you have very good analytical skills, are interested in handling large amounts of data and have the ability to see patterns and draw conclusions that support the commercials.
   

  

 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply at latest June 30th 2024 with your CV and a short personal letter. For more information, contact Daniel Nilsson, Head of Customer Intelligence at daniel.nilsson@sas.se.
   

  

**Working at SAS**
 Benefits of working with us in SAS include attractive travel possibilities, free gym access and a good pension scheme. We offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international fast-paced working environment. SAS is dedicated to the continuous development of its employees. Frösundavik is a great place to work. There is a gym, restaurant, café, and a variety of services to make your life easier. It’s located in a green area of Solna and close to Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. There’s a non-stop bus connection from the Central Station to Frösunda, commuter trains to/from Solna Station, and a good network of cycle paths.

title: Senior Cyber Security Architect
description:
**Company description:**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who want to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.
   

  

**Job description:**
 As an IAM Architect, you'll have the position in designing and implementing identity and access management solutions within the organization. Your collaborative efforts with diverse teams will ensure that business requirements and regulatory standards are met through effective IAM strategies. Beyond just designing solutions, your role extends to assessing the current infrastructure, crafting IAM frameworks, and seamlessly integrating solutions across systems. Your expertise will be crucial in selecting the right technologies, establishing standards, and ensuring compliance with regulations. Ultimately, your contributions will be pivotal in fortifying data security and facilitating the organization's business objectives through robust IAM practices.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design and implement IAM solutions leveraging HRM tools, IDM tools, and IGA tools, ensuring seamless integration with business systems.
* Architect global directory solutions, including Active Directory, Entra ID, and federation solutions such as Entra ID, ADFS, and PKI.
* Optimize and manage PAM solutions to enhance security and access control.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and develop IAM strategies aligned with business objectives.
* Provide technical guidance and mentorship to cross-functional teams on IAM best practices and technologies.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies in IAM, continuously enhancing your knowledge and expertise.


**Qualifications**
**Mandatory requirements:**
* Proven experience in architecting and implementing IAM solutions, with a strong understanding of HRM tools, IDM tools, and IGA tools.
* Expertise in global directory solutions, including Active Directory, Entra ID, federation solutions, and PKI.
* Familiarity with PAM solutions and best practices for access management and security.


**Optional requirements:**
* Experience with Saviynt as an IGA tool and BeyondTrust PasswordSafe knowledge.
* Certifications in IT frameworks and IAM technologies, such as CISSP, CISM, or vendor-specific certifications.
* Knowledge of security controls and compliance standards, including ISO standards.


**Start:** 
 Immediately
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a full-time position with a placement in Stockholm
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment
   

  

 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.

title: Business Analyst
description:
The Business Analyst role serves as an innovative and collaborative business partner between multiple business stakeholders and IT to define and identify processes and process improvement opportunities. This individual will ensure that business needs are being met in an effective and efficient manner and works closely with leadership to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions. The individual must apply creative thinking, communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of our IT systems investments. This position will document stakeholder requirements, measure/monitor process efficiency, and develop and manage projects. They will coordinate implementation, testing, training, and communication efforts between IT and multiple business groups. This is a business-facing and technology-facing role, requiring excellent communication and organizational skills to create alignment amongst multiple sponsors. The Business Analyst will:
   

  

* Partner effectively with business stakeholders and subject matter experts in a collaborative manner, building constructive and effective relationships thus ensuring that business processes are understood, documented, and fit the needs of the organization.
* Collaborate with subject matter experts and Product teams in the planning, design, and development of new and/or existing IT solutions.
* Lead Discovery/Innovation Sessions to identify opportunities that delight customers and/or internal users and enhance operational effectiveness in a meaningful way.
* Map processes from current to future state, define business and tech requirements and scope, and proactively champion change to business stakeholders and development teams.
* Execute assigned projects in accordance with PMI standards enabling successful business outcomes.
* Produce high quality documentation for requirements, solution options, business cases, and recommendations on proposed solutions.
* Participate as a change agent to implement new strategic directions and technology decisions.
* Support Product teams in translating business requirements to detailed stories/tasks for development teams to deliver business functionality.
* Assist business stakeholders with testing of system changes and analyze data flows for process improvement opportunities.
* Partner with Product Owner on product vision, requirements definition, and capability mapping to ensure requirements align with business unit processes and needs.
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact with a diverse group of team members, including executives, managers, IT professionals, and subject matter experts.
* Strong change management skills and the desire to make a difference.
* Ability to influence and gain the support of key stakeholders across the organization.
* Proven ability to facilitate requirement workshops / training sessions with large groups of business users and leadership.
* Ability and proven experience to translate stakeholder requirements into technical specifications that can be used for development, breaking down technical complexities so that they can be easily understood by business units and end users.
* Experience in process mapping, group facilitation, data gathering and analysis, and phases of project life cycle (requirements gathering, design, development, deployment, training, and measuring effectiveness.)
* Strong analytical, problem solving and project management skills.
* Strong ability to work effectively within time constraints, changing priorities,
* Ability to apply cost/benefit analysis in assessment and recommendation of new system solutions.
* Be self-directed, requiring minimal supervision while achieving consistent, timely delivery of objectives.
* Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of related work experience is preferred.
* CBAP certification is a plus.
* Experience leveraging cloud solutions to accelerate business value driven projects.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite: Including Visio, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.

title: Supporttekniker till RCO Security!
description:
Har du ett stort tekniskt intresse för IT & nätverk och brinner för problemlösning? Är du dessutom redo att ta dina servicekunskaper till nästa nivå? Då kan rollen som Supporttekniker till RCO Security vara perfekt för dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag – vi tillämpar löpande urval.
 



  

**Företag :**
 RCO Security
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Kundtjänst
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, tillsvidare
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Augusti/september
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 RCO Security är en ledande leverantör som arbetar med tillverkning, utveckling och med att sälja tjänster och produkter inom passer- och säkerhetssystem. Genom att hålla goda relationer till sina under skapar RCO en trygg, säker och smidig vardag – vare sig man har behov av ett kodlås vid en enda dörr eller ett stort integrerat system för styrning av passer och inbrottslarm i flera fastigheter spridda över landet.
 


  


 RCO grundades 1976 och har sedan dess etablerat sig som en ledande leverantör på den nordiska marknaden. Huvudkontoret ligger i Stockholm, Solna men de finns även i Norge och Finland. Sammanlagt har RCO cirka 110 anställda fördelade i tre länder där merparten arbetar i Sverige.
 


  


 Just nu söker RCO en stjärna till deras supportavdelning. Som Supporttekniker kommer du att ingå i ett team på nio personer där du kommer att arbeta med First Line Support mot RCOs återförsäljare och slutkunder. Rollen passar perfekt för dig som har ett tekniskt intresse för IT och nätverk samt som brinner för att arbeta med service!
 


  


  

**Hos RCO erbjuds du:**



  

  
* En trivsam och familjär arbetsplats med en öppen och lättsam stämning bland alla medarbetare
  
* Arbete i ett tryggt team där alla stöttar varandra
  
* Ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag
  
* Goda utvecklingsmöjligheter
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Hantera inkommande ärenden via telefon, mejl och chatt
  
* Teknisk support inom RCOs produkter mot återförsäljare och slutkunder
  
* Arbeta med problemlösning gällande frågor knutna till hårdvara, mjukvara och konfigurering
  
* Tillhandahålla produktinformation, användar- och installation manualer till kunder och partners
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad gymnasieexamen
  
* Är flytande i svenska, både i tal och skrift samt har goda kunskaper i engelska
  
* Har arbetslivserfarenhet inom service
  
* Har ett tekniskt intresse samt kunskaper inom IT och nätverk
  
* Har goda kunskaper inom Microsoft 365
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* B-körkort
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* **Problemlösande**
  
* **Serviceinriktad**
  
* **Anpassningsbar**
  
* **Samarbetsinriktad**
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**RCO Security**

 Läs mer om RCO Security här .
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till RCO Security**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sally Ismail eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på recruitmentstockholmsouth@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104411

title: Partner Sales Manager, Google Workspace, Public Sector
description:
**Minimum Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 8 years of experience in driving sales growth within a direct and indirect sales.
* 6 years of experience in partner sales or channel management, within the technology sector in SaaS.
* Experience working in a sales role partnering with external c-suite level customers.
* Experience in working with workspace technology products, cloud solutions, and the partner clients.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with cloud ecosystem.
* Knowledge of System Integrators (SIs)/Service Providers (SPs) and Independent Software Vendors (ISVs).
* Ability to grow in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
* Passion for Generative AI landscape.


**About The Job**
 The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Drive partners to build a robust partner sourced sales pipeline, track opportunities, and accurately forecast business in collaboration with partners providing regular reporting to management.
* Meet and exceed partner-level monthly, quarterly and annual agreed goals for new business and expansion of sales pipeline, as well as operational metrics.
* leverage the Google Web Server (GWS) strategy and sales plays with partners to develop a healthy new and expansion demand across the assigned region, deliver partner sales enablement including pitching and demoing together with partner engineers.
* Develop relationships with Google Workspace partner engineers and Google partner engineers ensuring customers receive quality technical guidance and solution delivery from our portfolio.
* Partner with cloud partner development managers and sales teams to develop joint account plans, identify opportunities, and support the closing of complex agreement.


 Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.
   

  

 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to building a workforce that is representative of the users we serve, creating a culture of belonging, and providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), expecting or parents-to-be, criminal histories consistent with legal requirements, or any other basis protected by law. See also Google's EEO Policy, Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal, Belonging at Google, and How we hire.
   

  

 If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
   

  

 Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles unless stated otherwise in the job posting.
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees, or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
*Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.*
**Your role at Tink**
 As the demands on our analytics capabilities continue to grow, we are seeking an experienced Analytics Engineer to help take us to the next level. We aspire to build a world-class data platform and analytics team, designed to fuel our product development with insightful reporting, deep analysis, and robust testing frameworks. By joining Tink, you’ll be part of shaping the future of data-driven decisions at a leading fintech player.
   

  

**What We Look For**
 We are searching for someone who can help Tink be at the forefront of data-informed decision making. We value a "we're in this together" attitude and an ambition to balance quick wins with building a solid foundation for the future. You are passionate about all aspects of data, from deeper technical work like setting up the data tooling needed, to collaborating with data consumers on more strategic objectives. We think that you have several years of experience in the data and analytics area, perhaps as an analytics engineer, data analyst or data engineer. You have been working hands-on with modern data tools and how to get them up and running on cloud providers such as Google cloud.
   

  

**Day-to-day**
 As a key member of the Product Analytics team at Tink, you'll play a central role in ensuring access to clean, tested, and well-documented data. You'll spend time tuning SQL queries and optimizing data pipelines for efficient data delivery. A significant part of your role will be dedicated to ensuring high data quality, which includes crafting individual tests and developing a comprehensive framework accessible to others.
   

  

 Working closely with other teams in our Data & Analytics area, particularly our Data Engineers, you'll help construct a modern platform for data collection, transformations, and pipelines. As we broaden our collaborative efforts across Tink, you will play a major role in enabling teams to own and maintain their own data sets within our data warehouse, empowering them to conduct independent analyses.
   

  

 A substantial part of your time will be spent working with dbt, BigQuery, and other Google Cloud services. As we transition towards dbt, you will be instrumental in ensuring a successful transition, setting us up for efficient and effective data operations in the future. With the constantly evolving data field, you'll also stay updated with the latest tools, technologies, and best practices in the industry.
   

  

**Required Qualifications**
* Several years of experience as an Analytics Engineer or in a similar role, with a focus on data solutions, data models, and data pipeline architecture.
* Proven track record of leading data solution projects and initiatives from inception to delivery.
* Excellent communication skills with experience in collaborating with various stakeholders across different levels of the organization.
* Excellent SQL and data modeling skills. Proficient in Python or a similar scripting language.
* Hands-on experience with dbt and cloud providers, with a proven track record of implementing and managing data solutions in these environments.
* Experience with data quality management, including writing tests and developing data quality frameworks.
* Ability to adapt to the evolving trends in the data field, and willingness to learn and implement new tools and technologies as required.
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Systems, or a related field is preferred.


*Who we are at Tink*
*We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.*
*People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.*
*We're looking forward to your application!*
 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  

 Tink’s 500+ employees serve more than 300 banks and fintechs in 18 European markets, out of offices in 13 countries. We power the new world of finance. For more information, visit tink.com.

title: Senior DataOps Engineer
description:
Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for a Senior DataOps Engineer who is expert in data pipelines and enhancing data strategies to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  


**Your Role**
 In your role as a Senior DataOps Engineer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will scope, design, and implement developer experience focused on pipeline efficiency and infrastructure for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry!
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components. You will also contribute to creating pipelines and supporting infrastructure to enable self-service workflows across these capabilities.
   

  

  

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will work with DataOps in the whole chain from hardware to ML and LLM using modern approach and best practices to cater business needs for TRATON.
* You will create tools to aid in management and infrastructure of data.
* You will enhance the current pipelines and visualisation by integrating to the developer portal.
* You will encourage and improve knowledge sharing by working with peers from across the organization, sharing your experience, learning from others and contributing to our shared knowledge base.
* You will evaluate the performance of our solutions and seek ways to improve them.


  

  


**Qualifications**
* Programming experience in Python and scripting experience.
* Experience with containerization, Cloud Computing (AWS or Azure preferred), Kubernetes, Kafka and Graphana.
* Automation and orchestration experience including Terraform, Helm, GitLab CI, ArgoCD.
* Experience in setting up monitoring for infrastructure and applications with tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, OpenTelemetry.
* Experience in configuring and troubleshooting container environments.
* Experience in data driven development, preferably within the ML context.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


  

  

**Experience with the following is meritorious:**
* Developing pipelines for ML and LLM products.
* Working with Big data in an industrial context.
* Previous experience working with a data pipeline from distributed hardware to a central data store.
* Working collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum environment.


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Please apply as soon as possible but no later than 2024-02-27. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.
   

  

 and Elvedin Ramic (Group Manager, EEDCE) +46855350687

title: Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
We are currently seeking a
 **Marketing Automation Specialist** 
 to join our Marketing Automation Team. This role is part of our mission to personalize customer interactions and become a truly data-driven organization. This position is a
 **1-year temporary** 
 vacancy covering parental leave.
   

  

 I’m Karl Holmström, leading the Marketing Automation Team within the Digital Team at Telia B2C Sweden. Our team is a fantastic group of individuals, and I’m proud of each member. We’re excited to welcome new talent to enhance and create new opportunities for customer communication. If you’re passionate about crafting top-tier, data-driven customer journeys in the Martech and marketing automation space, this role is perfect for you!
   

  

**Is this your next opportunity?**
 As a marketing automation specialist, you will help us realize new campaigns and marketing activities in our outbound and inbound channels as well as track and optimize already existing communication journeys. You will use customer data and insights to target the right customers in the right way and work towards a unified customer experience in multiple channels. It is important that you find business and marketing as interesting as technology and data, since both areas will be needed to be successful in this role.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Operate our marketing automation system and CDP, executing digital 1:1 communication activities.
* Design, build, and optimize marketing automation journeys across all digital channels.
* Define audiences and create target group selections.
* Work in a cross-functional tribe setup with experts in marketing, e-commerce, content and analytics.


**Is this you?**
 A marketing automation specialist with a broad skill set in channels and platforms. You’re responsible, analytical, and goal-oriented in your problem-solving approach. You can translate ideas into actionable steps and concrete use cases. You execute complex initiatives and proactively address issues innovatively and systematically. In your previous roles, you’ve successfully built automated customer journeys, improved performance, and delivered clear business value through marketing automation.
   

  

**Your Experience:**
* At least one year of experience in Marketing Automation, preferably with Salesforce Marketing Cloud.
* Salesforce Marketing Cloud Certifications is a plus.
* Experience with CDPs and experience in data modeling and SQL is a plus.
* Proficiency in HTML/CSS/JS for creating web and mobile landing pages and managing responsive email templates is a plus.


**Telia is more than a workplace**
 With us you will learn from skilled colleagues across international borders, joining a team that makes each other stronger and the world better by solving challenges. We are proud of our friendly atmosphere where people are excited about their work. We thrive on our diversity and ambition to deliver great products and extraordinary experiences for our customers. In a world where choices are endless, if you want to make a real impact, this is a place where you belong.
   

  

**Apply to join us!**
 If you’re interested in joining my team, apply for the job! For further information, email me at karl.holmstrom@teliacompany.com.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so don’t hesitate to get in touch. The last application date is 2024-06-26.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and to making sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent.
   

  

 During the process, required background controls will be performed.
   

  

**Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!**

title: Lösningsarkitekt till Green Cargo i Stockholm
description:
**Brinner du för att jobba innovativt och strategiskt i molnarkitektur? Sök då Lösningsarkitekt till Green Cargo i Stockholm!**
 Här får du möjlighet att vara en del av ett hållbart och viktigt bolag som bokstavligt talat får svensk industri och handel att rulla på! Som Lösningsarkitekt hos oss på Green Cargo kommer du erhålla en bred och inspirerande roll där du bl.a. kommer utveckla våra molnplattformar som främst är inom Microsoft Azure. Här blir du en naturlig värdeskapare och bidrar till vår fortsatta digitaliserings- tillika transformationsresa. Resan har bara börjat och det finns stora möjligheter för dig att påverka hur den kommer rulla på framåt!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Ett företag som fokuserar på klimatet där C02-minskning är en del av vår dagliga verksamhet.
* En strategisk nyckelroll i vår föränderliga och komplexa IT- och affärsmiljö med stort ansvar samt möjlighet att påverka framtiden.
* Spännande samarbeten både internt och externt, med kunder, myndigheter, leverantörer och andra järnvägsföretag.
* En sund och prestigelös arbetsmiljö, med goda förutsättningar för personlig och professionell utveckling.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 I Rollen Som Lösningsarkitekt Kommer Du Vara Drivande i Att Skapa Lösningsarkitektur För Våra Verksamhetsbehov Där Du Kommer Planera, Utveckla Och Underhålla Vår Arkitektur. Det Innebär Bland Annat
   

  

* Jobba både operativt och strategiskt för att säkra utveckling, innovation, stabilisering, säkerhet och kontroll inom våra plattformar.
* Möjliggöra principen Cloud First inom Green Cargo, där målet är att kunna hosta applikationer, system, integrationsplattformar samt säkerställa säker datatrafik till och från våra molnplattformar till legacysystem.
* Utveckla och modernisera våra legacysystem.
* Jobba med att främja automation, återanvändbarhet och skalbarhet.
* Delta i Architecture Review Board för att bevaka och besluta om ny och ändringar i arkitekturen tillsammans med andra arkitekter.
* Vara med och skapa ett transportsystem för miljövänliga transporter med Kundfokus, Lönsamhet och Säkerhet som tydliga fokusområden.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du kommer att ingå i avdelningen IT Technology som består av seniora arkitekter som är specialiserade på Enterprise-, Plattform-, Cloud och Integrationsarkitektur. Du kommer vara lokaliserad antingen i Stockholm eller i Hallsberg beroende vad som passar dig bäst. Vi jobbar hybrid där det finns en flexibilitet mellan kontoret och att jobba hemifrån.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har tidigare erfarenhet av att jobba som arkitekt, där vi gärna ser att du jobbat mot molnarkitektur och då gärna inom Microsoft Azure. Vi ser också att du erhåller en teknisk bakgrund från utveckling eller operation där du brinner för att utmanas i komplexa och större IT-miljöer med både egenutvecklade- och outsourcade system. Förespråkar du ett agilt arbetssätt är det ett stort plus!
   

  

 Som person har du en hög initiativförmåga med en vilja att driva utvecklingen framåt och är inte rädd för förändringar och att tänka nytt. Du trivs i en dynamisk och föränderlig miljö där du snabbt kan anpassa dig till nya förutsättningar. Då arbetet innebär flera interna och externa kontakter ser vi att du besitter en god kommunikativ förmåga och är flytande i både svenska och engelska. Samarbete och prestigelöshet är något som genomsyrar oss på Green Cargo och vi ser gärna att du delar dessa värderingar.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Network Architect / Engineer
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att jobba med nätverk och cloud? Vi söker nu en Network Architect / Engineer till Vings IT avdelning!
 



  





 Brinner du för nätverk och cloud? Vill du arbeta i en händelserik miljö och vara med och utforma framtiden inom nätverk? Då vill vi höra från dig! Vi vill satsa på området och söker därför flera personer till vårt Cloud Infrastructure Team.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som Network Architect/Engineer kommer du att vara med och driva arbetet inom nätverk framåt, Ving befinner sig i en stor transformationsresa in i molnet och här blir du en viktig del. I rollen kommer du att ha en framåtblick och omvärldsbevaka ny teknik samtidigt som du arbetar hands-on med allt från att implementera lösningar till att supportera utvecklingsteam gällande nätverksfrågor.
 



  





 Du kommer ingå i teamet Technology Services som ansvarar för ett modernt private cloud-datacenter byggt på Microsoft-teknologi, Azure public cloud-lösningar med tyngden på SaaS och PaaS lösningar. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras och du kommer ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
 



  





 Som Network Architect/Engineer kommer du att arbeta med att ta fram och driva roadmap för nätverk samt implementera och underhålla lösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer. Detta kommer bland annat innebära att:
 


* Designa, standardisera, underhålla och leverera nätverks plattformar i molnet och on-prem
* Vara drivande i arbetet inom arktiektur och roadmap för nätverk och i vår molnresa
* Samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att anpassa nätverkslösningar utifrån verksamhetens behov.
* Felsökning och problemlösning av tjänster och implementering av nya lösningar
* Guida och supportera verksamhet och utvecklingsteam i nätverksrelaterade frågor



  





**Vem vi söker** 




  





**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:** 



* Högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom IT fokuserade på molnlösningar och arkitektur, företrädesvis med Microsoft Azure
* Kunskap om Microsofts teknologistack för både privata och offentliga molntjänster
* Kunskap inom Azure Networking, Data centre network, SD-WAN, Network Security



  





**Det är meriterande om du även:** 



* Är certifierad inom IT arkitektur (ex. TOGAF, COBIT)
* Har kunskap inom Infrastructure as Code (IaC), ARM/Bicep, automatisering
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt



  





 Vi söker dig som har sinne för struktur, är noggrann och analytisk. Du tar självständiga initiativ och är en analytisk problemlösare som har förmågan att se saker ur ett helhetsperspektiv och förstå samband mellan detalj och helhet. Du är bra på problemlösning och har lätt att knyta relationer för goda samarbeten. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder** 




 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
 



 Vi är en arbetsplats med ett stort kunnande och en drivkraft att hela tiden bidra till att förbättra vår verksamhet. Vi är ett företag där vi har roligt och bryr oss om varandra med vårt people promise "it should be fun, developing and rewarding doing a good job".
 



  





**Om Ving** 




 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernen Nordic Leisure Travel Group. I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Urval sker löpande, så vi välkomnar din ansökan så snart som möjligt. I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Ving med Boxhill AB. Vill du veta mer, kontakta gärna ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Petra Törnblom, petra.tornblom@bhill.se
 



  





 🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet, 🤝 Tjänstepension, 🌎 Reseförmåner, 🦉 Utveckling och lärande, 💗 Well-being, 💼 Hybrid arbetsplats - Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här

title: Data Engineer Insight
description:
**Data Engineer**
**Do you want to build the next datamodels för AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?**
 Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.
   

  

**Do you want to be our next ”Data Ninja”?**
 Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Enjoy the flexibility of a dynamic work environment, including the option for part-time remote work. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
* Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
* Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
* Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
* Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
* Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
* You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.


**Based on our criteria för the role, we expect you to have:**
* Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
* Experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
* Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
* In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
* Experience in information and dimensional modelling
* Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
* Speaks English and Swedish fluently


 Have you previously worked on-premises? No problem, with us you get the opportunity to take courses and get certified in Azure.
   

  

**Meritorious** 
**experience:**
* Platform modernisation
* Tabular cubes and DAX
* Data Vault modelling
* Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure

title: System Manager
description:
**Om BDO** 




 BDO är ett ledande företag inom revision, redovisning och rådgivning, med ca 700 medarbetare i Sverige. De erbjuder personliga och skräddarsydda tjänster till sina kunder, med fokus inom revision, skatt, affärsrådgivning och outsourcing av redovisning och lön. De är engagerade i att ständigt utveckla sina tjänster och att ligga i framkant inom digitalisering och effektivisering av redovisningsprocesser. Hos BDO blir man en del av ett dynamiskt team som värdesätter samarbete, utveckling och flexibilitet.
 



  





 BDO erbjuder ett brett förmånspaket, hälsofrämjande aktiviteter, after work och mycket mer.
 



**Om rollen** 




 BDO söker nu en IT-utvecklingsledare till deras affärsområde Företagsservice, där du kommer ansvara för förvaltning och vidareutveckling av redovisningssystem och applikationer. Portföljen består huvudsakligen av system från Fortnox, men inkluderar även ett egenbyggt portalverktyg som deras kunder använder för att få åtkomst till systemen.
 



  





*Som IT-utvecklingsledare kommer du att:* 



* Förvalta och förbättra befintliga system, med fokus på att säkerställa att de möter affärsbehov och kundernas förväntningar.
* Driva utvecklingsprojekt och förbättringar i nära samarbete med affärsområdet.
* Ha budgetansvar och säkerställa kostnadseffektivitet i IT-investeringar.
* Kravställning och förhandling mot leverantörer



  





 BDO erbjuder flexibla möjligheter till distansarbete.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi tror att du som söker:
 


* Har minst ett par års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning inom redovisningssystem. Längre erfarenhet är starkt meriterande.
* Har erfarenhet av att driva utveckling och förbättringar av befintliga system.
* Har god kommunikationsförmåga och är skicklig på att samarbeta nära med affärsområden och olika intressenter.
* Är van att ta ansvar för budget och att arbeta kostnadseffektivt.
* Behärskar svenska väl i både tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet från redovisningsbyrå eller liknande är meriterande.



  





**Ansökan** 




 Det ska inte vara krångligt att söka jobb hos oss. Har du inget uppdaterat CV redo räcker det gott och väl att du ger oss din LinkedIn-profil och svarar på några korta frågor om din bakgrund. Ansökan tar bara några minuter och kan göras via din telefon.
 



  





 Rekryteringen startar redan innan sommaren, men kommer ta uppehåll vecka 29-31. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Software Developer to PerkinElmer
description:
When joining PerkinElmer, you select an experienced and trusted leader in scientific solutions, with the support of a global service network and distribution centers, providing the right solution, at the right time, to meet critical customer needs. With over an 80+ year legacy of advancing science and a mission of innovating for a healthier world, our dedicated team collaborates closely with commercial, government, academic and healthcare customers to deliver our broad portfolio of analytical solutions, and OneSource services.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Hybrid working – 3 days in Hägersten Office
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 PerkinElmer in Stockholm is looking for a motivated, experienced senior software development engineer professional to accelerate our growth of our Perten instrumentation which tests quality and performance in the Food Industry. Perten Instruments, a part of PerkinElmer’s Food Solutions business, has a rich 60-year legacy of providing leading testing instrumentation to the food industry, including near-infrared, process NIR, and rheology solutions.
 


  


 As a Senior Back-end Engineer, you will play a critical role in developing and maintaining the cloud infrastructure and services that power the Food instrument. We think that you have prior experience in AWS C# .NET windows stack, CQRS, Event Sourcing, and DDD, as you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing scalable and resilient systems. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to architect solutions that leverage these principles to enhance our products' performance, reliability, and maintainability. This role requires a deep understanding of distributed systems, event-driven architectures, and domain modelling. Write clean, maintainable, and testable code, following industry best practices and coding standards. Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to the overall system design.
 


  


 Identify and address performance bottlenecks, security vulnerabilities, and other issues in the back-end infrastructure. Monitor and troubleshoot production systems to ensure their stability and availability. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug and troubleshoot issues in legacy code bases.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Develop and maintain scalable, reliable, and high-performance backend systems using C#, .NET, IIS, SQL Server and AWS
  
* Understand and analyze legacy software systems to identify areas for improvement, updates, and modernization
  
* Collaborate with stakeholders, architects, and developers to devise strategies for upgrading and migrating legacy systems
  
* Develop and implement plans for refactoring, rewriting, or integrating new functionalities into existing software
  
* Perform maintenance tasks, bug fixes, and optimizations on legacy codebases
  
* Design and optimize databases and data models to efficiently store and retrieve large volumes of data
  
* Conduct thorough code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure high-quality codebase
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Bachelor/Master of Science in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
  
* Proven work experience (5+ years) in software development using C# and .NET framework.
  
* Database: Microsoft SQL server
  
* Proficiency in designing and deploying applications on AWS cloud services (e.g., EC2, Load balancer, S3, Lambda)
  
* Strong knowledge of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices.
  
* Experience of working with Rest API and Microservices based architecture
  
* You have experience building micro services and can decompose large monoliths into highly scalable, distributed, smaller components that follow micro service paradigms.
  
* Proficiency in writing efficient and optimized SQL queries
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Hands on experience in implementing Software Design Patterns and Enterprise level Design patterns [ e.g. Pub-Sub, DDD, CQRS and event sourcing]
  
* Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code tools is a plus
  
* Experience with modernization strategies, refactoring, and migration of legacy systems is a plus.
  
* Adaptability and willingness to work with diverse technologies and systems.
  
* You are comfortable with asynchronous programming, event driven architectures and writing decoupled applications.
  
* Drive continuous improvement by staying updated with emerging technologies and industry trends in AWS
  
* Background with database design, from crafting a schema from scratch, to writing efficient queries. Candidate should understand execution plans and how to utilize indexes
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 



 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Julia Fresk or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on julia.fresk@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105073

title: Senior backend developer to leading music company!
description:
Are you ready to revolutionize the way products and offers are managed in the digital commerce space? We are seeking a passionate and experienced Senior Backend Engineer to join our customer´s dynamic Opus Squad. The team is at the forefront of overseeing the Products and Offers domains on their client´s Commerce Platform, driving the end-to-end process of product creation, merchandising, order management, and purchase flows.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 Immediately
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 As a Senior Backend Engineer on the Opus Squad, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our client Commerce Platform. Your primary focus will be on the Products and Offers domains, where you will manage and enhance backend services and data sets. You will be responsible for the solution design and end-to-end implementation of new features, ensuring seamless integration and functionality within our product and offer creation ecosystem.
 


  


 This role requires a strategic mindset to align foundational entity data sets with our customer´s Commerce Platform Data Vision, as well as the technical expertise to build and scale robust services on the Google Cloud Platform. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, drive engineering deep dives, and effectively communicate with stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that power our merchandising, order management, and purchase flows.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and collaboration.
  
* Work on cutting-edge technology that shapes the future of digital commerce.
  
* Enjoy a supportive and inclusive work environment with opportunities for professional growth and development.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Design and implement new capabilities within our product and offer services, ensuring seamless integration and functionality.
  
* Develop and maintain multiple backend services and data pipelines to support our customer´s product and offer catalogue ecosystem.
  
* Align foundational entity data sets with our customer´s new Commerce Platform Data Vision.
  
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions.
  
* Lead engineering deep dives, workshops, and stakeholder demos, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Proven experience in building and scaling Golden Path (Java, Postgres, BigTable) services on Google Cloud Platform.
  
* A strong interest in data and data pipelines, with experience in technologies such as Scio and Flight.
  
* Excellent problem-solving skills with a strong bias for action and fast decision-making.
  
* Great writing and communication skills, capable of effectively conveying technical concepts to diverse audiences.
  
* Ideally, you have a background in e-commerce or financial engineering domains, bringing valuable insights to our team.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on filippa.karlberg@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104944

title: Business Developer - Swedish Market
description:
**Introduction** 




 Our international team is expanding the Sales department with talented Business Developers experienced in helping companies grow their client base. If you are an experienced Business Developer with a proven sales track record in selling services, rate yourself high on communication skills and know your way around clients, keep reading!
 



  





**Primary Responsibilities** 



* Develop a strong understanding of PCG’s business and well-defined service portfolio in order to turn leads to new sales
* Promote and represent PCG’s services
* Prospect and qualify new sales leads following a defined sales process
* Schedule meetings and presentations with prospects
* Create, plan, and deliver presentations on company services
* Daily tracking of all sales activities in company CRM system
* Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospects
* Develop strong, ongoing relationships with prospects
* Prepare, send and follow up on contracts sent based on company templates
* Collaborate closely with Solutions Architects when proposing solutions to prospects
* Negotiate contract terms with clients and communicate with stakeholders
* Ability and willingness to travel for meetings with prospective and existing clients
* Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort
* Meet or exceed monthly KPIs
* Create weekly reports for management
* Regularly collecting and analyzing the insights from the sales activities and providing feedback to the management team



  





**Qualifications** 



* Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field
* 3+ years of sales experience
* Native or bilingual Swedish speaker
* Fluency in English is a must
* Tech-savvy with a good understanding of IT concepts
* Working experience in the Tech industry or technical background
* Proven ability to meet and exceed sales quotas
* Proven track record of successfully managing customer relationships
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Highly self-motivated and achievement oriented
* Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills
* Proficient in Microsoft Office
* Working knowledge of CRM systems



  





**Desired Skills** 



* Self-confident
* Customer service oriented
* Upbeat, creative and highly engaged
* Great organizational skills
* Strong interest in cloud services
* Attention to detail, great listening and speaking skills
* Innovative – prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity
* Intermediate knowledge of a few other European languages



  





**We Offer** 



* Competitive compensation
* Premium equipment
* 20+ paid vacation days
* Personalised career path
* An international, friendly and collaborative environment
* Hybrid work model
* Possibility for learning and self-realisation
* Flat hierarchy and inclusive environment

title: Uppskilla dig i systemintegration!
description:
Gillar du att jobba med API:er och integrationer, och känner dig redo att utmanas i projekt som behöver expertis inom de senaste plattforms- och integrationslösningarna? Vi erbjuder nu möjligheten till upskilling genom en strukturerad onboarding och skräddarsytt utbildningsupplägg.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?**
 Hos oss får du möjligheten att jobba teamorienterat i meningsfulla och kundnära projekt. Vårt Cloud & Connectivity-team ansvarar för att designa, utveckla och implementera integrations- och plattformslösningar, ofta i en skalbar miljö. Vi har en cloud-first strategi och är ett av de ledande företagen i Norden gällande offentliga molnlösningar och -tjänster – i samarbete med viktiga aktörer som Azure, GCP och AWS.
   

  

 Våra integrationskonsulter är experter på att smidigt koppla samman affärskritiska system, migrera integrationer mellan plattformar, samt designa API:er och uppbyggnaden av dessa. Vi strävar till att vara tech-agnostiska med fokus på hållbara och långsiktiga lösningar som stöttar kundens verksamhet och väg framåt.
   

  

**Vårt upplägg**
 Vårt skräddarsydda upplägg hjälper dig växa som integrationskonsult och förbättra dina kunskaper inom exempelvis iPaaS, API design & utveckling, kravställning, och testning av lösningar. Målet är att växa dina färdigheter inom systemintegration för att ta del av ett större utbud av utmanande och spännande projekt där du får agera expert kring de bäst lämpade lösningarna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en strukturerad onboarding följt av ett anpassat upplägg där du, parallellt med kunduppdrag, har chansen att avsätta upp till 10% av din arbetstid specifikt på kompetensutveckling och certifiering inom de integrationstekniker som du önskar, såsom exempelvis Boomi och Azure. Du får därmed möjlighet att påverka din utveckling och inriktning på Solita från dag 1.
   

  

 Som en lärande organisation erbjuder vi även möjligheter att växa genom;
   

  

* Mentorskap och intern coaching
* Kompetensnätverk och föreläsningar
* Externa och interna lärplattformar
* Roll-specifika learning paths, såsom vår Architect path
* Varierande och roterande kunduppdrag


**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser helst att du jobbat med integrationsutveckling eller -arkitektur i några år, exempelvis med tekniker såsom BizTalk, Snaplogic, TIBCO, IBM Websphere eller Oracle, och vill nu fördjupa dig inom nya tekniker och plattformslösningar.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du har med dig;
   

  

* God erfarenhet av integrationslösningar oberoende av plattform;
* Erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande språk: Java, C#, Python, Golang, Node;
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


**Vad får du?**
 Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;
   

  

* Projekt som skapar avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället;
* Variation; i branscher, i team, i nya teknologier och system, i angreppsätt;
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg;
* En trygg och human arbetsmiljö för att främja innovation, motivation och välmående;
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med ett komplett förmånspaket bestående av exempelvis 30 semesterdagar, maxat friskvårdsbidrag, bike leasing, intern coach och ett omfattande försäkringsskydd samt pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet.


*Lyssna inte bara på oss – läs mer på* 
*Glassdoor* 
*!*
**Låter det spännande?**
 Berätta om dina färdigheter och önskemål, så tar vi tillsammans reda på om det kan bli en bra match. Detta är en löpande rekrytering.
   

  

 Om du har frågor får du gärna nå ut till oss på LinkedIn eller via mail: Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller Talent Acquisition Specialist Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

 Vi rekryterar i
 **Stockholm, Göteborg** 
 och
 **Malmö!**

title: C/C++ Developer
description:
Are you a passionate C/C++ developer with a few years of experience? Do you thrive on curiosity and the drive to learn and develop? If so, we want you on our team!
   

  

**Key Attributes:**
* Curious and Eager to Learn: We're looking for someone with a strong desire to continuously improve and expand their knowledge.
* Experience: A few years of experience in backend development particularly with C/C++, and Microsoft SQL Server.


**Qualifications:**
* University degree, or equivalent knowledge acquired through experience
* Proficient in Swedish and English, both written and spoken


**Technologies and Tools You’ll Be Using:**
* Primary: C/C++
* Additional: .Net C#, WCF Services, Web API, Docker, RabbitMQ, Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft Azure DevOps, Linux on Docker


 If you have experience with these technologies and tools, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

**About SD Worx :**
 SD Worx is a leading European provider of Payroll & HR services with global reach. We have offices in Europe and an office in Mauritius. Our goal? We bring people solutions to life. So, companies of any size can turn Human Resources into a source of value for the business and the people in it. Our people solutions span the entire employee journey, from getting people paid to attracting, rewarding, and developing talent. Are you ready to join us?
   

  

**What do we have to offer?**
* An attractive salary based on your experience and achievement.
* A dynamic environment: flexible working hours and working from home.
* Learning opportunities: through an individual development plan and professional training
* Career growth: whether you want to become more of an expert in your field our you want to expand your knowledge more horizontally, there is always room to grow within SD Worx!


 From many places, we work as one, moving from better to best together.
   

  

 SD Worx lives diversity in the workplace. Diversity provides inspiration and innovation in our company. We particularly welcome applications from qualified talent, regardless of origin, nationality, gender, skin colour, ethnic and social background, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation and stage of life.

title: Software Test Engineer - Internal Perception
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**


We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  


**Who are we**  

We are a team of 25 engineers dedicated to delivering Interior Sensing solutions. Our two teams encompass a diverse range of experience levels, from recent graduates to senior engineers. Representing six different nationalities, we use English for our daily communication.


Our cross-functional teams include System Designers, Software Developers, Testers, and Project Leaders. We foster a collaborative environment with activities that bring us closer together. Every Tuesday, we start the day with a joint breakfast alongside our sister group, the Roof Zone Module team. Once a week, one of our team members gives a presentation about themselves, helping us get to know each other better. On Thursdays, we enjoy Fika together.


We believe you perform best when engaged in work you enjoy. That's why we continually listen to your interests and strive to adapt your role accordingly.

  


**What you will do**


You will be testing various systems related to Internal Perception, which involve sensing what occurs inside the car. You will work with a cross-functional team to ensure our requirements are met by the implemented software. Your responsibilities will include testing at the component level, HIL (Hardware-in-the-Loop), and on complete vehicles. Additionally, where possible, you will automate the testing process.

  


**What you will bring**  

We are looking for you who have a M.Sc. or B.Sc. degree in Electronics, Software, Mechatronics or equivalent. You have several years of experience in Software Verification, preferably in an automotive context.


You need to have a valid European driver's license B.

  

  

**Meritorious experience:**


* SystemWeaver
* Elektra
* In-vehicle communication networks (eg. LIN, CAN)
* Vector tools
* Knowledge of Radar sensors

  


**Want to know more? We hope so!**


We'd love to receive and review your application if you want more information about the role and its responsibilities please reach out to the hiring manager Erik Liedholm (erik.liedholm@volvocars.com) or the recruiter Gabriela Moraes (gabriela.moraes@volvocars.com)

  


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
  

  

Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more here  

Curious about our story? Read more here
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior HIL Systems Integration Engineer
description:
**Company Description**  

Join the world of the future in a fast-growing international company! Be at the heart of innovation and create innovative human-centric technology with other engineers around the world. To really thrive as a consultant at Segula you enjoy getting the chance to insert yourself in different types of projects and clients. You receive insights to different types of project setups and have the opportunity to work closely with other highly qualified engineers and experts within your field.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a talented HIL Engineer to join our dynamic team and support our clients in revolutionizing their testing processes. We are a specialized consulting firm dedicated to providing top-notch engineering services to the automotive industry across Europe. In this project, our mission is to support our clients in the shift towards early-stage testing, helping them achieve efficiency and cost-effectiveness through advanced HIL systems.


As a HIL Engineer, you will play a crucial role in building and maintaining Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL) systems. Your responsibilities will include integrating Simulink plant models within the dSpace toolchain, collaborating with multiple development teams, and ensuring the HIL environment adheres to the highest standards of scalability and simplicity.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Integrate Simulink models into dSpace HIL systems
* Develop and maintain HIL setups, focusing on hardware and software connections
* Collaborate closely with development teams across different domains
* Share workload within a small, dedicated team to achieve common goals

 **Qualifications**  

* B.Sc. and/or M.Sc. in Electronics, mechatronics engineering or equivalent
* Experience with dSpace HIL-systems
* Proficient in Matlab/Simulink for modelling and simulation
* Solid understanding of electronics and wiring
* Knowledge of real-time controls, vehicle dynamics, and combustion engines
* Excellent English language skills! (both spoken and written)
* Familiarity with software development tools and processes (Git, CI/CD, Agile)
* Experience with test automation and verification tools (Pytest, Robot Framework)
* Knowledge of communication protocols (CAN, CANalyzer, CANoe)
* Swedish language skills are highly meritiorious!

**Who are you?**


We believe that you have effective problem-solving and communication skills! You must be proficient at diagnosing complex issues within the HIL systems and devise innovate solutions. We also see that you have strong analytical skills to interpret data and troubleshoot problems efficiently. Equally important is the ability to communicate effectively with various teams, ensuring that technical information is conveyed accurately.

 **Additional Information**  

* Secure employment and working conditions according to Swedish labor laws
* Competitive salary and benefit package
* Work with a collection of Segulas esteemed clients, leading companies in their field
* The chance to utilize your skill set to make real impact for the future of movement while having a dedicated consultancy company as your support
* Be a part of a growing network of skilled engineers
* Close relationship with your manager who supports you in your career development

A selection of company networking events  
* 

To thrive in this role we believe that you enjoy working collaboratively and that you are proactive in taking initiative. To apply for this position, you need to have a valid work VISA within the European Union. We embrace diversity and equality and attach great importance to your personal qualities. We are continuously recruiting, so welcome with you application today!

*We would like to inform you that our recruitment process is currently taking longer than usual due to the summer holiday period. We appreciate your understanding and patience during this time.* *For questions or further information, please contact talia.brorsson@segulagrp.com*
company_description: SEGULA is a gobal engineering group helping boost competitiveness within all of the major industrial sectors.

title: Senior System Engineer to Qvantum
description:
**Qvantum is a group of people who think differently, have a passion for entrepreneurship and strive to maintain a flat organization where all are expected to make a difference. They believe in making the impossible possible together – by building on each individual's personal strengths. The goal at Qvantum is to change the way cities in Europe are heated and cooled. Do you want to shape the future with them?**


Our world is in the midst of an energy transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources. Qvantum has developed a solution to tackle a difficult challenge that no one has been able to solve before – how to enable the many people in the big cities to live a life without dependence on fossil fuels for heating and cooling. They have developed a wide range of smart heat pump solutions for the next generation of heating and cooling technologies, built on modern software. The products are suitable for everything from small apartments to large property complexes and entire residential blocks.


Qvantum, with over 30 years of experience in heat pumps, has recently embarked on an exciting and extensive growth journey when a number of entrepreneurs with extensive experience from both the heat pump industry and the energy industry, acquired the company. They currently employ more than 250 employees, located in several European countries, and continue to grow at a rapid pace. With factories in Limhamn, Åstorp and Hungary, Qvantum is expected to become one of the leading players in its segment in Europe.


Qvantum offers exciting development opportunities, an inclusive work environment that encourages professional and personal development together with dynamic and forward-thinking colleagues. This job offers wide opportunities for growth and advancement as Qvantum scales up in Europe. Hybrid ways of working as well as a long-term incentive program are only a few of the benefits they offer. Now you have a unique opportunity to be part of the exciting growth journey that Qvantum is on!

**ABOUT THE ROLE**
------------------


As a Senior System Engineer in the dedicated team at Qvantum, you will play a crucial role in the continuous development of their advanced heat pump systems. Your primary focus will be on the heat pump system and the implementation aspects of the product, ensuring it integrates seamlessly with various applications. You will lead and oversee different stages of product development, maintaining a balance between all requirements while adhering to legislation, regulations, and industry standards. Your experience in similar roles will be invaluable as you provide technical expertise and support, both internally and with external stakeholders, to meet the customer expectations of Qvantum.


Your day-to-day responsibilities will include (but are not limited to) the following:

* Lead the continuous technical development of heat pump systems, focusing on implementation and application aspects.
* Dimension components, conduct lab tests, and develop verification plans to rapidly verify ideas.
* Analyze test results to ensure optimal system performance.
* Ensure that the systems meet customers' needs and standards.
* Provide technical support and guidance to the internal team.
* Collaborate closely with external component suppliers.
* Stay updated with industry standards as well as EU legislation and explore functional opportunities.

**WHO ARE YOU?**
----------------


We are seeking a seasoned system engineering professional adept at navigating the complexities of product development and implementation at scale. You ideally have a comprehensive understanding of heating and cooling systems, control mechanisms, and regulatory standards. This role is tailor-made for you who thrive in merging theoretical knowledge with practical application and is enthusiastic about steering technical aspects in the realm of heat pump development.


We are specifically looking for the following:

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, Physics Engineering, or a related field.
* Extensive experience in system engineering, preferably in the implementation of heat pump technology within various applications such as building heating, industrial processes, and control systems.
* Deep expertise in refrigeration, fluid mechanics, thermodynamics, and heat transfer, preferably as applied to refrigeration circuits and systems.
* Knowledge in specification, calculation, design, and testing of products and components in a mass-production setting.
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal.

##### **Personal competencies:**

* Driven and proactive.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Appreciation for a dynamic organizational scale-up phase, where flexibility and initiative are paramount.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively with a team.
* Attention to detail and a long-term perspective.
* Ability to lead others in assignments or projects is a plus.

**PRACTICAL INFORMATION:**
--------------------------

* Direct recruitment to Qvantum.
* Location: Åstorp, Sweden (Hybrid)
* Work hours: Regular office hours.
* Start: As soon as possible.

**NEXT STEP**
-------------


If you are excited about playing a pivotal role at Qvantum and contributing to the future of sustainable energy through innovative technology, we want to hear from you! Join Qvantum on this thrilling journey as they shape the future of renewable energy solutions.


Submit your application today and seize the opportunity to be part of Qvantum’s dynamic and driven team. At Qvantum, you'll experience a culture of initiative taking, quick decision-making, and continuous encouragement to test your own ideas.


For any further questions about the position, please contact Tobias Johansson at tobias@a-hub.se.


Please note that we do not accept applications via email. Ensure you submit your application through the A-hub careers website!
